definition: scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)

sentences.english: A clerk thumbed through the files looking for a letter.
sentences.chinese: 辦事員翻遍了案卷，尋找一封信件。

sentences.english: The sheet number of decisions is an obvious obstacle to finding case law.
sentences.chinese: 判決的案卷號對於查詢判例是一個明顯的障礙。

sentences.english: The reasons for service by public announcement and the process gone through shall be recorded in the case files.
sentences.chinese: 公告送達，應當在案卷中記明原因和經過。

sentences.english: She can cite a docket of cases of endless separation.
sentences.chinese: 她能說出許多無限期分居案例的案卷摘要。

sentences.english: The official records are kept in that building.
sentences.chinese: 官方的案卷存放在那幢大樓裏。

sentences.english: The court ordered certiorari following judicial review.
sentences.chinese: 在司法複審後，該法院命令調取案卷。

sentences.english: Yum China: Little Sheep Getting Tangled in Trade Friction?
sentences.chinese: 百盛收購小肥羊案卷入中美貿易摩擦？

sentences.english: This room has been set aside for the department files.
sentences.chinese: 這個房間已被用來存放本部門的案卷。

sentences.english: I checked the files and some of the papers were out of order.
sentences.chinese: 我檢查過案卷，其中有些未按順序編排。

definition: to commit sb for trial/to bring sb for interrogation
to put down in writing/to take down notes/transcript/record
to conclude a case/to wind up
oral confession (as opposed to 筆供|笔供[bi3 gong4])/statement/deposition
